popt4jlib.DE

Class DDE

  • java.lang.Object
    • popt4jlib.DE.DDE
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OptimizerIntf

    public class DDE
extends java.lang.Object
implements OptimizerIntf
    A parallel implementation of the Differential Evolution algorithm. The distribution of effort among threads is such so that each thread updates its own portion of the population. Implements both the DE/rand/1/bin and DE/best/1/bin variants. It must be noted that DE applies only to functions with domain the space R^n, and range the real axis R, and therefore cannot be applied to functions with other domains.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

        public DDE(java.util.Hashtable params,
   boolean setParamsOnlyFromSameThread)
        Constructor of a DDE object, that assigns a unique id plus the parameters passed into the argument. Also, it prevents other threads from modifying the parameters passed into this object if the second argument is true.
        Parameters:

      • getParams

        java.util.Hashtable getParams()
        return a copy of the parameters. Modifications to the returned object do not affect the data member.
        Returns:
        Hashtable

      • setParams

        void setParams(java.util.Hashtable p)
         throws OptimizerException
        the optimization params are set to a copy of p.
        Parameters:
        p - Hashtable
        Throws:
        OptimizerException - if another thread is concurrently running the minimize(f) of this object. Notice that unless the 2-arg constructor DDE(params, use_from_same_thread_only=true) is used to create this object, it is perfectly possible for one thread to call setParams(p), then another to setParams(p2) to some other param-set, and then the first thread to call minimize(f).

      • minimize

        public PairObjDouble minimize(FunctionIntf f)
                       throws OptimizerException
        the most important method of the class, that implements a Distributed Differential Evolution process. A number of threads work on different solutions in the solution array holding each iteration's population. For a given number of "tries", the process should run faster when given more threads assuming there are as many cores in the CPU running the process. Prior to calling this method, a few parameters must have been passed in either during object construction, or afterwards, by a call to setParams(p) These parameters are:
        • <"dde.numdimensions", Integer nd> mandatory, the dimension of the domain of the function to be minimized.
        • <"dde.numtries", Integer ni> optional, the total number of "tries", default is 100.
        • <"dde.numthreads", Integer nt> optional, the number of threads to use, default is 1.
        • <"dde.popsize", Integer ps> optional, the total population size in each iteration, default is 10.
        • <"dde.w", Double w> optional, the "weight" of the DE process, a double number in [0,2], default is 1.0
        • <"dde.px", Double px> optional, the "crossover rate" of the DE process, a double number in [0,1], default is 0.9
        • <"dde.minargval", Double val> optional, a double number that is a lower bound for all variables of the optimization process, i.e. all variables must satisfy x_i >e val.doubleValue(), default is -infinity
        • <"dde.maxargval", Double val> optional, a double number that is an upper bound for all variables of the optimization process, i.e. all variables must satisfy x_i <e val.doubleValue(), default is +infinity
        • <"dde.minargval$i$", Double val> optional, a double number that is a lower bound for the i-th variable of the optimization process, i.e. variable must satisfy x_i >e val.doubleValue(), default is -infinity
        • <"dde.maxargval$i$", Double val> optional, a double number that is an upper bound for the i-th variable of the optimization process, i.e. variable must satisfy x_i <e val.doubleValue(), default is +infinity
        • <"dde.de/best/1/binstrategy", Boolean val> optional, a boolean value that if present and true, indicates that the DE/best/1/bin strategy should be used in evolving the population instead of the DE/rand/1/bin strategy, default is false
        • <"dde.nondeterminismok", Boolean val> optional, a boolean value indicating whether the method should return always the same value given the same parameters and same random seed(s). The method can be made to run much faster in a multi-core setting if this flag is set to true (at the expense of deterministic results) getting the CPU utilization to reach almost 100% as opposed to around 60% otherwise, default is false
        Specified by:
        minimize in interface OptimizerIntf
        Parameters:
        f - FunctionIntf the function to be minimized
        Returns:
        PairObjDouble an object containing both the best value found by the DE optimization process, as well as the best argument that produced it.
        Throws:
        OptimizerException - if another thread is concurrently running the minimize(f) method of this object or if the optimization process fails
